page.title: 19NONCONFORMIST CHURCHES.
page.content: {UNITED REFORM CHURCH, CLYRO} A stone building with cottage attached was erected in the grounds of Pentwyn by the owner in 1880. It is now owned by trustees. Terms of the Charity state that the building can be used only for nonconformist services. It is now one of five churches in the Talgarth circuit of Reform Churches. Services ae held on alternate Sunday afternoons. There are 12 members. {BAPTIST CHURCH, BRONYDD} Founded in 1875, the building is a listed structure, formerly an outbuilding of Rookwood. Afternoon Services are held on the second and fourth Sunday of each month. Lay preachers occupy the pulpit. The "Sankey" Hymn Book is used. An Anniversary Service is held in August and Harvest Festival in October. There is a membership of fourteen.
